intro: Thesium hirtum, commonly known as the hairy thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is closely related to the grass family. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, pale yellow to white flowers in clusters, typically blooming during the warmer months. Thesium hirtum is often found in open, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
